titles.title: Imported Food Labeling Act of 1987
A bill to require that any imported food be labeled to specify the country of origin.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to Subcommittee on Domestic and Foreign Marketing.

committee.subcommittee: Domestic and Foreign Marketing and Product Promotion
committee.name: Senate Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

bill.summary: 5/15/1987--Introduced. Imported Food Labeling Act of 1987 - Amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, the Federal Meat Inspection Act, and the Poultry Products Inspection Act to require imported food, meat, and poultry to be labeled with the country of origin.
